revised_title: An Unusual Black Dust Shower in Zetland
tldr: In October 1755, a shower of black dust fell in the Island of Zetland. The dust resembled lampblack and had a strong sulfur smell. It was followed by rain, and some attributed the event to an eruption of Hecla, a nearby volcano. However, the wind direction did not support this theory, and the dust was not observed in Zetland at its first traveling to the southward.
